msContents.summary: Fragment containing a few letters from the ends of Homer, Odyssey XI 557-573 and the first halves of 588-610.

msItemStruct.note: Main text is 21 lines written with the fibers. Top margin is clean. Two columns of text, left and containing only a few terminal letters. Right column partially intact to about 15 characters. Vertical crack/holes running through the center of this textblock obscuring few letters.
The other side contains a few letters in 2nd CE cursive.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: 8.5 x 12.5cm. Several small holes and tears, especially along the crease where it was once folded vertically.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1896-7) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1901, Dr. Parrish Collection).

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

listBibl.bibl: P. Fay. 310 John R. Abercrombie, “The University Museum’s Collection of Papyri and Related Materials,” Expedition 20.2 (Winter 1978): 32-37. LDAB 1484; Mertens-Pack 1102; Allen-Sutton p11
